gt_metadata.revision_notes: v3.0: Tier changes: GT-05: T1 -> T2; GT-08: T2 -> T3; GT-11: T2 -> T1. Previous: 2.2_corrected_2026-01-14_v3_LOCKED

ground_truth.issue: Non-exclusive appointment with Supplier competition rights
key_elements: Non-exclusive distributor status
Supplier can sell directly within Territory
Supplier can appoint other distributors
Cross-territory sales permitted (customers outside Territory can resell within)
Distributor's investment in territory development unprotected
Should negotiate exclusive territory OR exclusive product lines
Limit or prohibit direct Supplier competition on Distributor-sourced leads
ground_truth.contract_text: Supplier hereby appoints Distributor as a non-exclusive distributor of the Products within the Territory... Supplier reserves the right to: (a) sell Products directly to customers within the Territory; (b) appoint other distributors within the Territory; and (c) sell Products to customers outside the Territory who may resell such Products within the Territory.

ground_truth.issue: Unilateral price changes with no cap
key_elements: Supplier can modify prices with only 60 days notice
No cap on price increases
No right to terminate if price unacceptable
Distributor locked into minimum purchases at unknown future prices
Should add price cap (CPI or 5% annual max)
Longer notice period (90+ days)
Right to terminate on material price increase (>10%)
ground_truth.contract_text: Distributor shall purchase Products at the prices set forth in Supplier's then-current price list. Supplier may modify prices upon sixty (60) days' prior written notice.

ground_truth.issue: Mandatory minimum purchase with automatic breach trigger
key_elements: $100K per quarter minimum ($400K/year)
2 consecutive misses = automatic material breach
No cure period before breach declaration
No good faith negotiation on shortfall
No adjustment for market conditions or force majeure
Should reduce minimum or make adjustable based on territory performance
Add cure period (e.g., 60 days to make up shortfall)
Add negotiation rights before breach declared
ground_truth.contract_text: Distributor agrees to purchase a minimum of One Hundred Thousand Dollars ($100,000) of Products per calendar quarter during the Term of this Agreement. Failure to meet minimum purchase requirements for two (2) consecutive quarters shall constitute a material breach.

key_elements: Distributor cannot assign without Supplier consent
No restriction stated on Supplier assignment
Supplier could assign to competitor or unfavorable party
Blocks Distributor M&A or business sale
Should have mutual assignment provisions
Add M&A/affiliate exception for Distributor
Add consent not to be unreasonably withheld
ground_truth.contract_text: Distributor may not assign this Agreement without Supplier's prior written consent.

ground_truth.issue: Low liability cap for both parties
key_elements: Cap at 12 months payments applies to BOTH parties
May be insufficient for product liability or recalls
No carve-outs for IP, willful misconduct, gross negligence
No carve-outs for indemnification obligations
Increase to 24+ months
Add carve-outs for critical claims
Consider higher cap for Supplier (product manufacturer)
ground_truth.contract_text: NEITHER PARTY'S TOTAL LIABILITY SHALL EXCEED THE AMOUNT PAID BY DISTRIBUTOR TO SUPPLIER IN THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS PRECEDING THE CLAIM.

ground_truth.issue: No indemnification clause - Distributor exposed to product claims
key_elements: No product liability indemnification from Supplier
No IP infringement protection
Distributor exposed to third-party claims for product defects
Distributor has no control over product design or manufacturing
Critical for physical goods distribution
Should add Supplier indemnification for product defects, recalls
Should add IP infringement indemnification
Should cover defense costs and settlements
ground_truth.contract_text: N/A - No indemnification clause exists in contract. Articles 1-13 contain no indemnification provisions.

ground_truth.issue: FOB shipping terms shift all transit risk to Distributor
key_elements: Risk passes at Supplier facility
Distributor bears all transit risk including damage, loss, delay
Distributor pays shipping, freight, insurance, handling (4.3)
Should negotiate DDP or CIF terms
Require Supplier-arranged transit insurance
Risk to pass at Distributor facility
ground_truth.contract_text: Unless otherwise agreed in writing, all Products shall be delivered FOB Supplier's facility. Title and risk of loss shall pass to Distributor upon delivery to the carrier.

key_elements: 1.5% per month = 18% APR
Above typical commercial rates (prime + 2-3%)
No exclusion for disputed amounts
Should reduce to 1% or prime + margin
Exclude disputed amounts from interest
Add grace period before interest accrues
ground_truth.contract_text: Any amounts not paid when due shall bear interest at the rate of one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month.

ground_truth.issue: Marketing approval required for all materials
key_elements: ALL advertising must be submitted for approval
No timeline for approval/rejection
No deemed approval mechanism
Could delay time-sensitive marketing
Add deemed approval if no response within 10 business days
Limit approval requirement to major campaigns only
Pre-approve standard templates
ground_truth.contract_text: All advertising and promotional materials prepared by Distributor shall be submitted to Supplier for approval prior to use.

ground_truth.issue: Termination effects lack buyback and transition
key_elements: 90-day sell-off period (better than Reseller which has none)
No inventory buyback right - stuck with unsold inventory after 90 days
No transition assistance from Supplier
No refund of prepaid amounts
Rights terminate immediately except sell-off
Should add Supplier buyback at cost for remaining inventory
Add transition period for customer handover
Add refund of prepaid but undelivered orders
ground_truth.contract_text: Upon termination: (a) all rights granted to Distributor shall terminate; (b) Distributor shall cease use of the Trademarks; (c) Distributor may sell remaining inventory for ninety (90) days.

ground_truth.issue: Supplier can reject purchase orders - no supply obligation
key_elements: Supplier can accept OR reject each purchase order
Only 5 business days to respond
No obligation to accept orders even within forecast
Distributor commits to minimums but Supplier doesn't commit to supply
Creates supply uncertainty
Should require acceptance of orders within agreed capacity/forecast
Add deemed acceptance if no rejection within period
Add supply assurance for forecasted quantities
ground_truth.contract_text: Distributor shall submit purchase orders to Supplier in writing. Supplier shall accept or reject each purchase order within five (5) business days of receipt.

key_elements: Cannot actively solicit outside Territory
Cannot establish operations outside Territory without consent
Standard distribution restriction
May limit growth opportunities
Passive sales outside Territory should be permitted
ground_truth.contract_text: Distributor shall not actively solicit sales or establish any branch, warehouse, or distribution centre outside the Territory without Supplier's prior written consent.

ground_truth.issue: Consequential Damages Exclusion Missing Critical Carve-Outs
key_elements: Mutual exclusion of indirect/consequential damages
Blocks recovery for lost profits from product defects or supply failures
No carve-out for indemnification obligations
No carve-out for breach of confidentiality
No carve-out for willful misconduct or gross negligence
No carve-out for IP infringement claims
Distribution relationship involves significant opportunity costs
Should add carve-outs for: confidentiality breach, IP infringement, willful misconduct, indemnification obligations
ground_truth.contract_text: 10.1 NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION LOST PROFITS OR LOST BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES.

issues: GT-11 (4.1 - Supplier can reject purchase o)
GT-05 (10.2 - Low liability cap for both par)
GT-07 (4.2 - FOB shipping terms shift all t)
GT-08 (5.3 - High late payment interest rat)

v2.1_changes: PROMOTED GT-06 (missing indemnification) from T2 to T1 - critical for physical goods distribution
ADDED GT-11 (4.1 PO rejection) as T2 - supply risk similar to Supply contract
Renumbered GT items for logical flow
Enhanced key_elements with more specific remediation guidance
contract_verification: All clause references verified against actual contract text
4.1 verified: 'Supplier shall accept or reject each purchase order within five (5) business days'
No indemnification article exists in Articles 1-13
Article 12 is Confidentiality only (12.1) - no 12.2 exists (phantom clause in original GT was correct to remove)
alignment_with_other_gts: Indemnification now T1 across all three contracts (Distribution, Reseller, License missing)
Non-exclusivity T1 for Distribution (physical goods investment), T2 for Reseller (lower capital risk)
PO rejection risk now tracked in both Supply and Distribution
